title: Mathematics Instructional Design Through Systems Theory and Constructivist Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics) and basic understanding of constructivist learning theory
context.additional_context: A collaborative learning environment using learners' personal digital devices (BYOD), with a continuous feedback system through formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can structure complex mathematical problems by applying core principles of systems thinking.
Learners can design projects interpreting relationships between mathematical concepts under a constructivist framework.
Learners can improve their interpretive approaches through peer feedback in a PBL environment.

resources: Cloud-Based Collaboration Tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Notion)
Digital Mathematics Modeling Software (e.g., Desmos, GeoGebra)
Open Educational Resources (OER) on Systems Theory

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
